title: AbuseReport data exchange
description: AbuseReport is a class by VESNX Project C.A.R.E. with the data format that will allow a abused service to get legal representation from the legal community as jurisdictions and computer crimes acts can be described.

Recorded-UTC.description: The date the abuse was recorded

Source-ip.description: The IP address that is causing the abuse

MITRE-Tactics.description: Tactics represent the "why" of an ATT&CK technique or sub-technique. It is the adversary's tactical goal: the reason for performing an action. For example, an adversary may want to achieve credential access.

Destination-ip.description: The IP address that is being abused

Destination-Country-Code-Numeric.description: Contains the numeric ISO code of the country where the abused IP address is hosted. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes

Attack-Type.description: Free text concerning the type of attack

Uri-Schema.description: If set, the abuse is URL-based, and this represents the schema of the URI

Uri-Host.description: If set, the abuse is URL-based, and this represents the host part of the URI

Uri-Path.description: If set, the abuse is URL-based, and this represents the path part of the URI

Uri-Query.description: If set, the abuse is URL-based, and this represents the query part of the URI

Http-Method.description: If set, the abuse is URL-based, and this represents the HTTP method like GET, POST, HEAD...

Http-Headers.description: Request header dictionary if the abuse report is reporting a web-based exploit containing header key and header value

Http-Cookies.description: Cookie dictionary if the abuse report is reporting a web-based exploit, and a cookie-based attack is reported, the dictionary contain cookie value name and value key pairs

Http-Form.description: A dictionary if a form is used in the abuse for web-based attacks. The dictionary contain form field and value key pairs

Body.description: The raw body content reported: if the report is web-based, it's the raw HTTP body; if a mail-based abuse, it contains the raw mail body; if a socket-based attack, it contains the raw socket data. Essentially, this contains the raw attack/abuse exploit in the abuse.

Content-Type.description: The content type being reported in the body of this abuse report

Abuse-Email.description: The email address the abuse report is sent to

Email-Subject.description: Subject line of mail based abuse reports, this should reflect the actual subject line of the email

Email-ReplyAddress.description: The reply-to email address for receiving replies or follow-ups in regards to the abuse report.

Email-MailBody-Has-Links.description: Indicates whether the body of the email-based abuse report contains hyperlinks. This could include hyperlinks in an abused web application contact form, as well as hyperlinks in emails. These hyperlinks may indicate drive-by infections, phishing, or scams.

Reported-To-Isp.description: Indicates if the abuse has been reported to the internet service provider

Incident-Title.description: The title of the abuse report, similar to the subject of an email, and should have a brief explanation of what is being reported

Exploit.description: An explanation of why you feel this is a valid abuse report and contains the legal & forensic details not covered by the properties of the abuse report object

Source-Country-Code-Numeric.description: Contains the numeric ISO code of the country, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes

ASN.description: The name of the internet service provider that hosts the abusing IP address

Source-Country-Code-Alpha.description: Two-letter country code of the country, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes

Destination-Country-Code-Alpha.description: Two-letter country of the code of the country where the abused IP address is hosted. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes
